name: Supreme Court of India
description: The highest judicial forum and final court of appeal under the Constitution of India.

name: Delhi High Court
description: Serves as the highest court of appeal in the Union Territory of Delhi.
location: Sher Shah Road, New Delhi, Delhi 110003

name: Bombay High Court
description: Serves as the highest court of appeal in the states of Maharashtra and Goa, and the Union Territories of Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu.
jurisdiction: Maharashtra, Goa, Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Daman and Diu

name: Calcutta High Court
description: The oldest High Court in India, serving as the highest court of appeal in the state of West Bengal and the Union Territory of Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
jurisdiction: West Bengal, Andaman and Nicobar Islands

name: Madras High Court
description: Serves as the highest court of appeal in the state of Tamil Nadu and the Union Territory of Puducherry.
location: High Court Campus, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600104

name: Income Tax Appellate Tribunal
description: Specializes in hearing appeals against orders passed by the Income Tax authorities.

name: National Company Law Tribunal
description: Adjudicates issues relating to companies in India, including insolvency resolution.

name: Securities Appellate Tribunal
description: Hears appeals against orders passed by SEBI, IRDAI, and PFRDA.

name: National Green Tribunal
description: Specialized body for effective and expeditious disposal of cases relating to environmental protection.

name: Competition Commission of India
description: Prevents activities that have an adverse effect on competition in India.

name: District Court, South Delhi
description: District and Sessions Court handling civil and criminal matters in South Delhi district.
location: Saket Court Complex, New Delhi, Delhi

name: Family Court, Mumbai
description: Deals with family matters like matrimonial disputes and custody of children in Mumbai.

name: Juvenile Justice Board, Delhi
description: Deals with cases involving juveniles in conflict with law in Delhi.

name: Lok Adalat
description: Forum for resolving disputes through conciliation and compromise.

name: Debt Recovery Tribunal
description: Established for expeditious adjudication and recovery of debts due to banks and financial institutions.
